title: Segregated rail cars quote - point of view

content.description: “One by one the southern states have legally disfranchised the Afro-American, and since the repeal of the Civil Rights Bill nearly every southern state has passed separate [railroad] car laws with a penalty against their infringement. The race, regardless of advancement, is penned into filthy, stifling partitions cut off from smoking cars.”
content.question: The author of the statement above was

choices.label: an African American journalist in the 1890s
a White southern Democrat in the 1930s
an African American Civil Rights worker in the 1970s

content.answer: an African American journalist in the 1890s

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Identify  a source's point of view, purpose, historical situation, and/or audience.
